result.execSummary:
The defendant Reuben J. Schulz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

bond refunded - surety withdrawn

Clerk Cheree
Case called: 9:58am
State appears by ADA C.Minder; Defendant appears in person/pro se; Brandon Hawley (surety) appears in person.
(Hearing re: Return of Bond money)

State notes Mr. Hawley has filed request for return of bond money posted on behalf of defendant Reuben Schulz
COURT questions amount posted - Mr. Hawley notes $500 was posted and would like it to be returned to him.
COURT questions defendant re: payment plan 

COURT allows $500 cash posted by Mr. Hawley to be returned; Defendant to set up payment plan in COC office immediately.
Hearing on March 25, 2015 at 10:00 am.

w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief (filed in 15CM32)

State appears by ADA C.Minder.  Def appears in person and with Atty John Zich.

State moves to:

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty

COURT ORDERS: 29 day MCJ on each count, concurrent, w/credit for 4 days of time served on each case, w/huber for work and treatment, if defendant found eligible under jail classification system, jail stayed up to 45 days; CC.
